title: Wardley-Doctrine Survey
description: Get 10-15 ppl in your org to colour the chart.

sections.title: Communication
sections.description: Each question below is a Team-Level Goal, not an Individual Goal. Choose the option that you feel is most appropriate

questions.title: Be transparent (a bias toward open)
Focus on high situational awareness (conversations are had in their proper context)
Use a common language (necessary for collaboration)
Challenge assumptions (speak up and question)

sections.title: Business Development
sections.description: Each question below is a Team-Level Goal, not an Individual Goal. Choose the option that you feel is most appropriate

questions.title: Know your users (eg. customers, stakeholders, regulators, staff)
Focus on user needs
Think Fast, Inexpensive, Restrained and Elegant (FIRE formerly FIST)
Remove bias and duplication (systems, processes, roles, whatever...)
Use appropriate processes (eg. agile vs lean vs 6 sigma) depending on the context
questions.description: Ex: Lean for an early stage startup, `Agile` at scale, and 6 Sigma for Mars-Rover level software-quality

questions.title: Focus on the outcome not a contract (eg. worth based development)
Be pragmatic (it doesn't matter if the cat is black or white as long as it catches mice)
Use appropriate tools (eg. mapping, financial models)
questions.description: This is specifically asking in a business development context

questions.title: Use standards where appropriate

sections.title: Operation
sections.description: Each question below is a Team-Level Goal, not an Individual Goal. Choose the option that you feel is most appropriate

questions.title: Manage inertia (eg. existing practice, political capital, previous investment)
questions.description: One measure would be how consistency of velocity: does it get slower as more code is written.

questions.title: Optimise flow (remove bottlenecks)
Think small (as in know the details)
Effectiveness over efficiency
Do better with less (continual improvement)
Set exceptional standards (great is just not good enough)
Manage failure

sections.title: Organization Structure
sections.description: Each question below is a Team-Level Goal, not an Individual Goal. Choose the option that you feel is most appropriate

questions.title: Provide purpose, mastery & autonomy
Think small (as in teams, 'two pizzas')
Distribute power and decision making
Think aptitude and attitude
Design for constant evolution
Subcultures can flourish within the overall culture
questions.description: There is diversity of thought and approach

questions.title: Seek the best

sections.title: Learning
sections.description: Each question below is a Team-Level Goal, not an Individual Goal. Choose the option that you feel is most appropriate

questions.title: Use a systematic mechanism of learning (a bias towards data)
A bias towards action (learn by playing the game)
A bias towards the new (be curious, take appropriate risks)
Listen to your ecosystems (acts as future sensing engines)

sections.title: Leading
sections.description: Each question below is a Team-Level Goal, not an Individual Goal. Choose the option that you feel is most appropriate

questions.title: Be the owner (take responsibility)
Move fast (an imperfect plan executed today is better than a perfect plan executed tomorrow)
Think big (inspire others, provide direction)
Strategy is iterative not linear (fast reactive cycle)
Strategy is complex (there will be uncertainty)
Commit to the direction, be adaptive along the path (crossing the river by feeling the stones)
There is no core (everything is transient)
Be humble (listen, be selfless, have fortitude)
Exploit the landscape (capitalize on contextual opportunities)
